meanings.definition: The left side of a ship when facing forward.
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered on the portside to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The cargo was loaded onto the portside of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the portside railing, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight danced on the portside, painting the waves silver.
meanings.sent5: The storm hit the portside with such force that the ship tilted dangerously.

meanings.definition: Located on the left side of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The portside cabins offer stunning views of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The portside engine hummed steadily during the voyage.
meanings.sent3: The crew enjoyed a peaceful evening on the portside deck.
meanings.sent4: The portside lights guided the ship safely through the night.
meanings.sent5: The portside windows were adorned with colorful curtains fluttering in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To turn or move towards the left side of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain decided to portside to avoid the rocky shore.
meanings.sent2: The ship began to portside as it approached the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The crew had to quickly portside to dodge the oncoming vessel.
meanings.sent4: The sailor expertly portside the wheel to navigate the narrow channel.
meanings.sent5: The captain's order to portside came just in time to avoid a collision.
